definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc

sentences.chinese: 他们给房顶装置了防火设备。

sentences.english: The water has penetrated into the bedroom, so there must be a hole in the roof.
sentences.chinese: 水已经进入卧室，所以肯定在房顶上有洞。

sentences.english: I rised my head and saw the ceiling was dropping, felt the classroom was sinking.
sentences.chinese: 我抬头，看见房顶往下塌，感觉教室在不停地下沉。

sentences.english: The roof let in the rain.
Let them be as the grass upon the housetops, which withereth afore it groweth up
sentences.chinese: 愿他们像房顶上的草，未长成而枯干。

sentences.english: Whenever the evening, I would climb the roof to watch sunset.
sentences.chinese: 每当傍晚，我都会爬上房顶去观看晚霞。

sentences.english: His frustration was interrupted when the gargoyle from the roof came crashing through the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 城主的挫败感被一个从房顶穿过入室的恶魔打断了。

sentences.english: The birds like to fly and perch on rooftops, but none have flown away.
sentences.chinese: 火鸡喜欢飞，喜欢在房顶栖息，但没有一只飞走。

sentences.english: Is that snow on our roof?
sentences.chinese: 我们的房顶上满是雪吗？

sentences.english: Stop cry, or you'll raise the roof.
sentences.chinese: 别吵了，否则房顶都被你掀掉了。

sentences.english: The rain was pouring through a hole in the roof.
sentences.chinese: 雨水从房顶的漏洞哗啦啦地流了进来。

sentences.english: All the house were of wood with red-painted iron roofs.
sentences.chinese: 房子全是木制的，房顶有刷有红漆的铁板制成。

sentences.english: A little hamlet, whose roofs were blent with trees, straggled up the side of these hills.
sentences.chinese: 房顶和树掺杂著的小村落，散布在山的一边。

sentences.english: Hadley abruptly jerks Andy to a stop right at the edge.
sentences.chinese: 哈雷猛得在房顶边扯住安迪。

sentences.english: Using that kind of bullet, you can shoot through roofs and wooden walls.
sentences.chinese: 使用这样的子弹，你可以射穿房顶或是木墙等。

sentences.english: Keep the tree from toppling by tying it to a ceiling hook.
sentences.chinese: 将树顶端固定在房顶的挂钩上，以避免树倾倒。

definition: floor/floor (ie. metal plate, concrete slab, wooden planking etc)
